isis.stitle: RADIATOR/COOLING SYSTEM SERVICE MANUAL - PROSTAR™ - COOLING PACKAGE COMPONENTS - FAN DRIVE ASSEMBLY

svcprocinfo.para: Two types of fan drives are available on the ProStar™, Borg Warner and Horton. Borg Warner is the standard fan drive, and the Horton fan drive can be ordered as an option. The procedures in this service manual cover both fan drives.

step1.para: Unlatch and open the hood.
Loosen two spring clamps and remove the left charge air cooler hose ( Figure 10, Items 2 and 3).
Remove two bolts and washers from the top fan shroud ( Figure 11, Items 1 and 2).
Beginning with the top plastic hold tab, release three plastic hold tabs and remove the top fan shroud ( Figure 11, Item 3).
Remove six nuts, lock washers, and washers from the radiator fan ( Figure 12).
Remove the radiator fan from the fan drive.
Insert ratchet in belt tensioner release hole, relieve tension from fan belt, and remove fan belt ( Figure 16, Items 1 and 3).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Borg Warner Fan Drive Assembly

step1.para: Disconnect the air line from the mount hub.

important.para: The bottom of the mount hub is slotted to fit over the lower mount bolt. The bottom bolt can be loosened, without being removed, and the mount hub will lift off the bolt to aid in the removal of the fan drive.

step1.para: Suspend fan drive and mount hub with a sling.
Loosen, do not remove, lower mount bolt. Remove three other bolts from the mount hub.
Remove fan drive from front of engine.

important.para: The bottom of the mount hub is slotted to fit over the lower mount bolt. The bottom bolt can be partially installed and the mount hub will slide down on the bolt to aid in the installation of the fan drive.

step1.para: Install lower mount hub bolt in engine; turn bolt into threaded hole two full turns only ( Figure 18, Item 6).
Using a sling, install the mount hub on the lower mount bolt ( Figure 18, Items 2 and 6).
Install three remaining bolts in mount hub ( Figure 18, Item 1).
Torque four mount hub bolts to 88 to 99 lbf-ft (119 to 134 N•m).
Connect air line to mount hub ( Figure 18, Item 3).

note.para: Inspect fan belt for damage and wear prior to installation. Fan belt should be replaced if any defects are found.
Manual re-tensioning is not needed on belts equipped with a spring-loaded automatic belt tensioner.

step1.para: Position fan belt on all pulleys except belt tensioner ( Figure 16).
Insert ratchet in belt tensioner release hole, relieve tension from tensioner, and install fan belt on belt tensioner ( Figure 16, Items 1 and 3).
Install the radiator fan on the fan drive.
Install six washers, lock washers, and nuts on the radiator fan ( Figure 12). Torque nuts to 25 lbf-ft (34 N•m).
Align top fan shroud on bottom fan shroud and engage three plastic hold tabs ( Figure 11, Item 3).
Secure top fan shroud with two washers and bolts ( Figure 11, Items 1 and 2). Torque bolts to 13 to 14 lbf-ft (18 to 19 N•m).
Install left charge air cooler hose and secure two spring clamps ( Figure 10, Items 2 and 3). Torque spring clamps to 6 lbf-ft (8 N•m).
Close and latch the hood.
